They are thin. Not as bad as motel towels, but close. They do seem to be made well, the color was spot on, and the measurements were true... but they are not the same quality as the original towels I got years ago. The reason for the decent rating? Climate change is REAL people! Which means my house is a million times more humid than it ever was before. Consequently, thick towels never dry and always smell like mildew, even when clean. These guys are thin enough that they air dry well, so no dampness or mildew smell. I guess I'm changing my expectations along with time changing things (like the damn weather). Overall, for the price I think these towels are a good deal. If you're not looking for plush, thick towels, but ones that get the job done and are wellmade, I think these will do. I am satisfied enough that I will most likely buy another set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Amazon Basics - 6 Piece Fade Resistant Oversize Bath Towel, Hand and Washcloth Set, 100% Cotton, Navy Blue
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thick and soft, with derail to use.', 'author': 'Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A great set of towels and facecloths, good soaker uppers and I love the colour!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice towels for the price', 'author': 'Dawna Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are well made, heavy, absorbent, great value for the money. Not very soft but that wasn’t important to us - being absorbent was.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Insane Fuzziness / Shedding', 'author': 'Kinsey', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These are soft, well pigmented towels, and they are a great value; however, they shed like no other towel I have ever purchased. If the towels weren't such a great deal otherwise, I'd give them only 3 stars. The fuzz/shedding is, by far, the worst I've ever seen or experienced with any linens of any sort.I have washed these 4-5 times already, and they still leave black fuzz everywhere. I hope they aren't like that forever, but at this point, I'm afraid they will be.Especially noteworthy is, if you use contacts, you will find it impossible to dry your hands with these and then put in contacts without getting fuzz in your eyes... I mean, the fuzz gets and sticks everywhere, but in your eyes is especially problematic.I can't say I'd recommend these towels, even though I'm giving them 4 stars, because I think the level of shedding with these towels is enough to deter me from recommending them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wash before using!', 'author': 'Bonnie Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice towels. Yes, there is a lot of lint when you wash them the first couple of times. However, I just rinsed at first and discovered they were incredibly soft. However, not as absorbent until I washed them again with soap. They became slightly less soft (but still nice) and the absorbency increased substantially.They are a good size, perfect for adults. And the fact you get two entire sets for the price, a great deal. The navy blue towels are exactly the color I imagined. They look great in our bath.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Meh! bot that soft!', 'author': 'Nataly Kratos', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My experience with the Amazon Basics Bath Towel has left me with mixed feelings. While the towels are undeniably affordable, I found them to be less than satisfactory in terms of sturdiness. The material, although soft, doesn't seem to hold up well after a few washes, leaving me somewhat disappointed. If you're on a tight budget and don't mind sacrificing a bit on durability, these towels might suit your needs. However, if longevity is a priority, it might be worth considering other options in the market for a more robust investment in bath linens.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Equivalent to Walmart Towels', 'author': 'Jacqueline Cohen', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This review is being written after just receiving one towel set as a trial purchase. The towels arrived vacuum packed, and I was somewhat nervous as to whether or not they would fluff-up after being washed with soap and fabric softener. You should know that the water in the washing machine was the color of claret wine. Strangely, the bath towels fluffed better than the hand towels or the washcloths. They were still on the thin side, nevertheless. When dried, there was a huge amount of lint (perhaps 1-inch thick) in the dryer. In evaluating the absorbency, it was moderate. All in all, I decided to go ahead with purchasing more towels since they were quite reasonable. Be aware that if you decide--as I did--that you would chance more towel purchases, the price will go up significantly. Frankly, I felt duped!Addendum: After three washes, the wash water is now only the color of pink lemonade. It seems that the bath towels and hand towels are decent quality--reasonably thick and fluffy--but the washcloths are stiff and thin. The dryer is still coated with an inch of lint. Keep in mind that I only purchased one set of towels.Addendum #2 (the last one): I think that I have isolated the excessive lint problem. The bath and hand towels are of decent quality. On the other hand, the stiff, thin washcloths--that seem as though they are made of different material, but the same dye lot--are visibly losing the fibers and getting slight bald patches. Keep in mind that this is one week's worth of washing!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice towels!', 'author': 'Bronwyn writer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If you are a dog owner you know: your towels eventually become the dogs' towels, and you suddenly need new towels for yourself.These towels are soft, nice looking, and easy to wash. The colors did not run when I washed them, and they did not pill. The blue is very bright, not quite navy, but a very nice shade.The towels are not overly thick, but they do a nice job drying.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good towels', 'author': 'Alicia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Soft, and absorbent , great for house use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'Karen D.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was looking for bath towels that are nice, but not cost an arm and a leg. I had read not so great reviews about these towels that people say the towels fade and especially shed, when washed, but I have not seen any fading at all, nor shedding. I purchased these towels about four years ago and they're still quite nice. As a matter of fact I'm going to order more of these same towels, except in a different color. If you're looking for some nice towels without paying a lot, I definitely recommend these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not too thick to dry', 'author': 'JP', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This set is not as thick as my luxury towels BUT! I live in the South where humidity is a challenge in the summertime. I wanted towels that would dry faster in between uses, so was looking for something a little thinner, and these are perfect. Vibrant color, and not so thick they'll never dry in the summer!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: American Soft Linen Luxury 6 Piece Towel Set, 2 Bath Towels 2 Hand Towels 2 Washcloths, 100% Turkish Cotton Towels for Bathroom, Light Grey Towel Sets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Luxurious Comfort for Your Everyday Routine!', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐I recently upgraded my bathroom essentials with the American Soft Linen Luxury Bathroom Towels, and I am beyond impressed with the quality and comfort they bring to my daily routine.The 100% Turkish cotton construction of these towels is nothing short of exceptional. The material is incredibly soft and plush, providing a luxurious feel against the skin. The towels are not only absorbent but also quick-drying, making them a practical and efficient choice for busy mornings or post-shower indulgence.What sets these towels apart is the remarkable durability. After multiple washes, they maintain their softness and color vibrancy, showing no signs of wear and tear. But, as with most new towels, they are manufactured with a coating that almost repels water and causes a lot of lint. I’ve seen a lot of the reviews complaining of this issue. You MUST do this to rid the towels of the excess lint!…..BEFORE washing them, put them in the dryer and use the no-heat setting. My dryer says “Refresh”. Just a cool temperature. Run the dryer for 30-50 minutes and you’ll see the lint collecting in the trap. Empty trap after each run. I used five cycles until there was barely any lint left in the trap (See picture). Advertised at 27x54" (1458 sq/in or 0.94 sq/meters). Actual measurement was 26"x50.5" (1313 sq/in or 0.84 sq/meters) before first drying. That\'s a big deal to me, and more than 10% smaller AREA than advertised. Just charge 10% more, and give me what I ordered, please... No shrinkage from low heat drying. Some fade in the color despite being washed in cold water with vinegar, and the towels are no longer quite "navy" but are a pretty deep blue. They can look a little purplish under some lighting, but that\'s likely the type of light you use. Measured towel weights about 535-540 grams. For the advertised dimensions, it works out to about 575 GSM or the true (smaller than advertised) actual dimensions 640 GSM. If you\'re expecting to get what you paid for, look elsewhere. After laundering and soaking the towels, the saturated weight of the towel was 2220g or about 4.1:1 for water retention, which you\'ll see is middle of the pack of the old towels I compared it to.I compared the American Soft Linen towel to an old Target brand Fieldcrest Luxury (Made in India) 27"x56" towel which after 10+ years of use was still 27"x55.5" The Fieldcrest weighed 709g or about 725 GSM, and it feels more like a true luxury towel. Noticeably thicker and denser. Fully soaked, then formed into a ball and squeezed, the Fieldcrest saturated weight was 2615g. A ratio of 3.7:1 for water weight retention. As is typical with high GSM towels, absorbency isn\'t quite as good as towels in the 600 GSM area.I also compared the American Soft Linen to an old Linens \'N Things (Made in the U.S.A.) mid-grade towel. 27"x54" The edges of the towel showed no shrinkage after 15+ years, however, the decorative banding had shrunk a little bit. You can really tell how worn out the LNT towel is compared to the very fluffy soft, new American Soft Linen towel, but the towels feel sort of similar in weight/density. The LNT towel weighed 595g or about 630 GSM. Fully soaked, then squeezed, the LNT saturated weight was 2,634g for a ratio of 4.4:1 for water weight retention, the best of the 3.Final thoughts: I chose American Soft Linen because of the reviews, the price, and looking into the company which imports products from Turkey, rather than China as I like to see more global manufacturing source options. The American Soft Linen Luxury towels had an actual 640 GSM rating which is a bit better than expected; however, they were 10% smaller than the advertised size (this was across all 3 sets I ordered in different colors). The towels feel quite soft, and they seem decently absorbent. The towels survived their first laundry cycle with no pulls or loose strings and they seem well made, but expect "navy" to fade some. These towels are a tick lighter than true luxury towels, and they\'re very fluffy once properly laundered which makes them feel lighter still. So if you want denser, heavy feeling towels, you will not be pleased with these. Overall, I\'m disappointed because these towels are substantially smaller than advertised, but at least they are significantly less expensive than luxury towels at the big box store, and they feel like they\'ll hold up and work well. If they were the correct size, I\'d give this 4 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Glad I made the purchase.', 'author': 'Sarah', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Possibly like others, I'm the sort of person who, when looking for something on Amazon, I'll buy the item which has the most reviews, thinking you can't go wrong with something that's clearly pleased thousands of others above a plethora of other options. And, thus, I hardly ever check said reviews. Seeing that the product(s) have more reviews than any other listed item is enough to sell me on it.It's sometimes only after I've placed my order & it's possibly even shipped that I bother to check what people are saying about the item, just out of curiosity. Which is what I did with the towels & washcloths I ordered here. And I panicked when I saw all the negative reviews about the extreme amounts of lint these items produce in washers, dryers, & upon other items, as well as the people using them. It was discerning to read that people were even having to empty their lint traps multiple times during a cycle due to it. Or, that they were having to clean out their washers, because it was stuck everywhere inside.But I couldn't cancel my order because they were already on their way to me by this point. So I said I'd give them a shot. Wash them, dry them, & try them. If I was unhappy, I'd simply return them & start looking elsewhere.I'm glad I didn't just immediately return them as soon as the box arrived. I might be one of few, but these towels & washcloths have caused me 0 issues. I don't know that it matters, but for reference, we have a Maytag 3000 Series matching set of washer & dryer. In terms of water: we have well water without a water softener, but we of course have a filter. So, the water could make a difference. Ours doesn't have a bunch of chemicals like fluoride & chlorine, unlike city water.When I washed them (on their own, I might add, since I was already paranoid about a mess—didn't want to be picking lint off clothing later if I could avoid it; I have enough on my plate), I put in only Tide Original liquid detergent. No fabric softener, no scent beads. Nothing fancy. Once the cycle was done, there was thankfully no lint in the washer. So, I then put everything into the dryer, forgoing including a dryer sheet.(You might wonder why I used only the detergent when washing. I read reviews on here, & in an article that when you get new towels & do your first wash or two, to not use fabric softener or dryer sheets, as it can make the issue of lint worse.)I checked the lint trap three times during the drying cycle, as I was afraid that it'd get full multiple times as the dryer ran. Instead, it was full about three-fourths of the way through, so I emptied it. When I went to retrieve the laundry about 15 minutes later once it was done, the trap was still empty.I did include a picture of how much lint my dryer collected during the cycle, with the base of a wire hanger underneath for reference. In terms of how thick the lint was, I'd say it's about how much our dryer accumulates after perhaps 2 cycles. So not bad at all. And you have to remember that these items are brand new. Something is going to come off.Then came the big test: time to shake out a towel & a washcloth, & see how much of a mess they make. So I opened our back door & stepped out, as I didn't want it all over the laundry room, & I shook a towel first, then a washcloth, as hard as I could. And I was shocked! Only a couple tiny strings came off the towel. That's it. No lint from either. No strings even from the washcloth.So I'm pleased in there being 0 mess.I did, a couple days later, have enough laundry to do another load. So, I put another towel & washcloth in, & used fabric softener this time, as well as a dryer sheet in the dryer. Once again, no problems. No lint.Onto size: I've also seen reviews of people complaining that either in the packaging or after washing & drying, the towels are/become flat. I didn't experience that. I've included pictures of the towels & washcloths both measured & compared to ones we've been using. For the washcloth: the grey one lying next to the white one I bought is one of my favorite washcloths that we have. I actually thought it was large, compared to many of our other ones! Imagine my surprise.Finally, I came to the most important test: how do they hold up when being used for their actual purposes? The washcloth was just fine in the shower. It cleaned me like it was supposed to & suds-upped easily, without any lint getting all over. The towel dried me just as well as our old ones, & no lint ended up all over the floor or shower.All in all, I have no reason to be upset with my purchases. I know they're pricey, but I feel they were worth it. I was actually thinking of—so long as I liked the towels—ordering another set or two. Due to how large they are, however, I don't think they'd even fit where I'd need them to (this is not a complaint)! Same for the washcloths. I ordered 5 packs, which would give me 20, but I then looked & found another color or two that I'd like to have, but due to how fluffy they are, I don't know that they'd all fit in the bin I intend to get from Target to place them all in.I won't say that if you're skeptical to just buy them & that you won't be regretful. You could end up like the others that have dealt with the horrible lint problem. But, remember if you take a chance on them, that Amazon has a good return policy (imo). So you can always send them back & get a refund.I'm just glad I won't have to go through that hassle & that they've worked out how I hoped they would! When I need new towels/washcloths in the future, so long as this listing is still up, it's the first place I'll look to buy from.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice towels, not quick dry', 'author': 'Casey', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are really nice towels - very soft, fluffy, and absorbent. This is well worth the price and a great purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT ABSORBTION AND FAST DRYING!', 'author': 'JoAnn D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These towels are the best! I purchased this set in Coral and I couldn’t be happier. The color is more of a burnished coral, toned down from some of the bright Coral colors you have probably seen on Amazon. This set consists of 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels and 2 wash cloths. I like that the hand towel dries rather quickly because I am always washing my hands and the hand towels I’ve had previously were always very damp and I had to use other towels. The face cloths are not the thick ones that you can’t use to clean your ears. The bath towel dries a lot quicker if you spread it out on a long towel bar. They are of medium weight and not too thick which is perfect for me. I have the thick, plush spa-type towels that take forever to dry, are heavy and more so when they absorb water. They also get cold, wet spots which are most uncomfortable. These towels have none of those issues. I was able to dry myself off, wipe down shower walls and floor plus shower curtain all with the same bath towel. Talk about high absorbtion!! Given the surprising price of this set, I think they are worth a lot more. The hems at the ends are double stitched and by all appearances, appear to be quality towels. They wash beautifully with no run of color. The dryer had a lot of lint with the first time drying and less in the second round of drying and a lot less with the third time and it appears to me, there will be even less lint as time goes by. A word of caution here and that is to not use fabric softener on towels. They coat the cotton fibers with PDMS (dimethicone) which is a silicone polymer oil that destroys absorbment properties and makes the towels stiff and scratchy. This happened to me in the past before I discovered this was the reason for loss of softness, absorbency and stiffness in towels. This is why manufacturers state on their labels not to use fabric softeners when washing and drying towels. Once you eliminate fabric softeners, you will notice and feel a difference. The only request I have for this company is to produce more colors like Ivory, Peach, a creamy Pink and a variety of colors you see from other companies on Amazon. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A Good, Average Quality Towel', 'author': 'Jorden', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My old towels were about 6 years old and perfectly fine, but I simply wanted new ones in different colors. My old ones are a nationally well-known brand that were sold by a major mid-range department store that has survived for 120+ years, and still has anchor stores in many mega malls across the country. I wanted to find similar quality towels in new colors. Boy, did I learn a lot about today\'s towel industry! I bought these towels thinking that they would be as good as my old towels that were considered "average" quality back then. These towels simply are no match for my old "average" towels. These towels are rather flimsy and light weight. And they aren\'t very absorbent. When you use one of these towels to wipe up water splashed on the counter, it will leave water streaks behind. It takes 2 or 3 passes to wipe all the water up.I learned that towels are rated by GSM, "grams per square meter". The towel industry rates towels as: 300 - 400 GSM (lightweight, thinner); 400 - 600 GSM (medium to higher weight, soft and absorbent); or 700 - 900 GSM (highest, heavy weight, luxury towels). They say these towels are rated 560. I think these towels are ok if you have kids and just want lighter weight towels to wash more often. I found this company\'s hand towels and face clothes to be fine with their lighter weight . But I found their bath towels to be not so great. As I said, they are sort of flimsy and don\'t feel very substantial. I am going to keep the hand towels and face clothes, but I have already purchased higher rated, luxury bath towels. They basically match what in the old days would be considered to be an "average" bath towel. And with the mega sales on towels these days, they didn\'t cost me that much more. I am going to donate these bath towels to charity.In summary, these days one really needs to think more about what they want in a bath towel before purchasing. If you just want an inexpensive towel, this brand is fine. But if you want something more luxurious, these towels are not heavier, luxurious towels.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I’ve found that I have to soak them in a pine-sol solution in the wash to keep the smell at bay.As of today, we’re using different towels, which is a bummer because I was all for the pros and less caring about the cons until the smell just couldn’t be taken anymore.Again, I wouldn’t even comment if the rest of my laundry had a funky smell. title: POLYTE Oversize, 60 x 30 in., Quick Dry Lint Free Microfiber Bath Towel Set, 6 Piece (Gray, Waffle Weave)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Waffle Weave—Cotton vs. Microfiber—it’s a tie for me!', 'author': 'PRW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'In an effort to do mini-makeovers on our bathrooms, I “redecorated” with new waffle weave towels. Ended up with cotton in the primary bath and these microfiber towels in the guest baths— I love both fabrics—the “pros” are basically the same; the differences could be consequential, depending on what you’re looking for.• All are huge—the bath towels are nearly the size of bath sheets or beach towels, and the “hand” towels are much bigger than most terry hand towels—perfect size for a head towel after shampoo.• Way more absorbent than terry! Waffle weave is definitely different from terry cloth, and some people may need a while to get used to them. I’m always up for anything new, but even my husband, who totally resists change, has adapted nicely.• Both fabrics dry, store, and launder much more efficiently than terry cloth.• They have an elegant, sophisticated look.• Differences—the cotton towels are slightly more supple and the microfiber are less expensive.So—these towels are definitely winners. If you’re looking for something slightly more luxurious feeling, go with the cotton; if you want something a little more economical, these microfiber towels are the way to go.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars NOT STICKY!', 'author': 'Rest_Panda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have tried several microfiber towels and we sent them all back because they had that rough, sticky, rubbery feeling where they feel like little fibers are hooking onto little bits of dried skin on your hands. Finally we have found a brand that doesn\'t do that. These towels are amazing! They are very absorbent, they dry quickly (you still need to hang them to dry...physics), and the waffle weave gives them a soft feeling (they are not fluffy like cotton towels but they feel very soft). The hubby even commented that they dry his hair and nooks n crannies in one take. No more surprise water drips from who knows where. The bath towel is very generously sized (the attached picture shows the green bath towel vs a regular sized cotton bath towel). It is big enough to wrap around my 6\' 1", 230 lb husband with plenty to spare. We bought them for travel but are seriously considering getting more to use at home too.We do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets, both of which could reduce the absorbency of towels. We have washed them in hot water and warm dryer with zero shrinkage. The only con I can come up with is that the wash cloth doesn\'t feel as \'scrubby\' as a regular cotton one, so for that purpose I will stick with my old cotton ones. Overall we are pretty happy with our purchase.ps: The green is not as bright as in the picture. It\'s a blue-green with more blue than green, and a tiny hint of gray. Still a pretty color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality and pattern!', 'author': 'Debbie H', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These have a beautiful waffle pattern and the blue color is very nice and as shown. Very different from a normal cotton towel…I like fluffy towels and these definitely are not fluffy. They do dry you off well and the towel themselves dry quickly. I plan to use them for camping in our motorhome, but I think I’ll keep my fluffy towels for home use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No lint!!', 'author': 'Jason', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We struggled with finding towels that wouldn’t give off a ton of lint. Even purchased 2 sets that were “low lint”. Washed them in vinegar, baking soda, etc. had zero luck. Found these and figured we give them a try. Finally!…no lint. Fast drying, large, and very absorbent. We will be buying 2 more sets of these.They are not as soft as a bath towel, but it’s worth the trade off.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent - Converted Us to Microfiber', 'author': 'TDY', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've always noted that if you want to see where the best quality products/materials are for cleaning and maintaining surfaces, look to the car detailing industry. They switched from cotton/terry to microfiber towels years ago...with these we finally did so for our bath, kitchen and hand towels. The performance and maintenance of these is so far superior, we're never going back to heavy cotton towels. title: Hawmam Linen White 6 Piece Bath Towels Set for Bathroom Original Turkish Cotton Soft, Absorbent and Premium 2 Bath Towels, 2 Hand Towels, 2 Washcloths
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and nice towels, my towels did not shed and no lint.', 'author': 'Jenn', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just opened the box with my new hand towels. The color I ordered is blue. It is a darker blue gray color tone and not a true sky blue tone which is fine and since I have a blue tile with different hints of blue color tones with in its pattern and the color blue of these towels match perfectly. It says on the directions to machine wash and machine dry before use. So I just finished taking these towels out of the dryer, I did use a fabric dryer sheet when drying the towels in the machine. The towels fluffed up nicely, they are nice and soft. I saw in some reviews that others experienced lint and shedding with their towels but I did not experience any lint or shedding with these blue towels, I'm wondering that if perhaps its because I used a fabric dryer sheet when drying the towels kept the towels lint and shedding free? I did not experience any of those issues with my blue towels or perhaps the blue ones are different then other colors? I only have the blue color towels and I can only comment on these. I have used them today and I am very happy with the fluffiness and thickness of these towels, and still so far it's lint free and no shedding. I tried shaking the towel, rubbing the towel on my face and hands, and even on my clothes and I even checked my sink and rubbed a tissue along the sink to see if any shedding or fabric debris would be on it but nothing, its clean with no lint and no shedding so I was extremely happy. The only issue I had with the towels was that in different rooms of my house the lighting is different making the texture of the towel look different, so in rooms that the lighting is extremely bright the texture of the towel does not look as soft or as nice but even though they are very soft it looked different in different light settings, in my bathroom the lighting is different and the towels looked perfect and even looked soft, I'm not sure why in my kitchen lighting the towels appear different. So I will not be using these towels as guest towels because of the lighting making the appearance of the towel in my guest bathroom look different in texture it made them appear looking not soft even though they feel soft it still looked different. Since I am using these towels in my bathroom and the lighting is different there they look soft and beautiful in my bathroom lighting, they work perfectly and look soft and pretty. I can't comment on durability because I have only used these towels once and so far I am happy. I got them on sale and I plan on using them as everyday towels. I am pleased with these towels for everyday use. If in time they prove to be durable I will buy more. They arrived early and in perfect condition.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good!', 'author': 'Mjthread', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm happy with these towels so far mostly because they have not thrown the strings like the Threshold towels I purchased a few years ago which were thick, soft and fluffy but with a large amount of strings as soon as they started being used and washed. These are definitely don't feel as luxurious, not as thick and fluffy but the color is pretty, they are a decent size, didn't put out a lot of lint first washing and are absorbent. I have washed them a few times and there are a couple of strings but not many. As long as they don't start to have more strings I'm good. If they do I will update my review because that was the main reason I needed new towels.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I Like Them But Theyre Not As Good As They Look In The Photos', 'author': 'AmazonCustomer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought these to replace 10 year old Walmart towels. The Walmart towels were extremely thick with extra long loops and a very dense weave and even after over 10 years of heavy use and machine washing, they are still thick, but no longer feel soft as they used to and do not look good. I am planning to retire these and use for doggie baths.I am comparing the Hawmam towels to the Walmart ones. My first impression of the Hawmam brand was the packaging. The towels were not fluffy and the package stated that was normal and to launder them and they would fluff up. I did machine wash and dry low heat and they did fluff up but I noticed the loops are not very dense and that contributed to towel drying faster than the Walmart towels. There is a noticeable lack of density of loops--yet the total weight of the towel is higher than expected given the less dense looping. The second thing I noticed is that 3 of my bath towels had long threads hanging. Do not pull on these because I did that to one and it pulled a whole section of looping out. It was very narrow but noticeable. What you should do with these towels is see if you can exchange or return them. I decided to keep mine so what I recommend doing with loose threads if you find them is cut them in half, tie the two half pieces in a surgeons knot and do it again, then snip any excess, but not the knot. Another bath towel arrived with one of these sections already apparent on the towel, without any abuse by me. I also had several hand towels and a washcloth that had loose long threads and I texted photos of all these imperfections to the number that they give you inside each package. The company politely asks for feedback on their towels after using them. They are nice towels overall. Theyre not as fluffy and dense as I was expecting, but theyre good enough that I chose to keep them. The Walmart towels are thicker and less flexible, take a long time to dry, are very heavy when theyre wet. Hawman is nice fluffy towel with shorter less dense loops, dries fast in dryer on low temperture!, soft on the skin, dried my skin and hair well and fast. I would not categorize these towels as luxury. Why? Because in my mind, a luxury towel will have longer more dense loops. I don\'t expect to see loose long threads and other issues with a luxury class towel. However, all things considered, they still seem to be nice enough for home use. I will be looking for a different brand for "company\'s coming" towels. Ive attached photos. I will update my review if I notice more issues as time passes and its used and laundered more. Would have given these 4 stars for value except there was too many issues in the sets I bought. I bought three sets, each set contains 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, 2 washcloths.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Luxurious and Absorbent Bath Towels for a Refreshing Experience', 'author': 'Erin Salmon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased the Hammam Linen Ice Silver 6 Pack Bath Towel Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed with their quality and performance. These towels have transformed my bathroom experience into a luxurious and refreshing retreat.First and foremost, the softness of these towels is exceptional. Made from original Turkish cotton, they are incredibly gentle against the skin, providing a comforting touch after a shower or bath. The fabric feels plush and velvety, elevating the overall bathing experience.In terms of absorbency, these towels truly excel. They efficiently soak up moisture, leaving your skin dry and refreshed in no time. I find that even with just a single use, they manage to absorb water effectively, making them ideal for daily use.The set includes 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, and 2 washcloths, offering a complete range of sizes for various purposes. Whether you need to wrap yourself in a cozy bath towel or simply dry your hands with a hand towel, this set has got you covered.What sets these towels apart is their premium quality construction. The stitching is meticulous, ensuring durability and long-lasting performance. Even after several washes, the towels have maintained their integrity, with no signs of fraying or deterioration.Furthermore, the Ice Silver color adds a touch of elegance to my bathroom decor. It effortlessly blends with any aesthetic, providing a sophisticated and polished look.In conclusion, the Hammam Linen Ice Silver 6 Pack Bath Towel Set is a fantastic investment for anyone seeking luxurious, absorbent, and premium-quality towels. They offer unmatched softness, excellent absorbency, and a stylish design that enhances the overall bathroom experience. I highly recommend these towels for both personal use and as a thoughtful gift for loved ones.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality hand towels! Soft & absorbent!', 'author': 'SMG', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My search is over for a great towel! These towels are exactly what I look for in a good everyday towel. When they first arrive, they are vacuum-packed & look very thin. But once they are washed, they fluff right up & become thicker & soft. They washed well in hot water... I did NOT use any fabric softener, dryer sheets, etc. There was no bleeding of the color.I like my towels to have a quality feel, while not being overly heavy, as those take forever to dry. These towels are lightweight & dry pretty quickly. As for soft, they are soft enough. I dislike ultra-soft towels as those are never absorbent enough. These are nice & absorbent. I can use them for a hair towel & they are large enough to wrap around my longish hair, without unraveling.While they are perfect for everyday towels .. they are also nice enough to use in a guest bathroom. I wouldn't hesitate to put them in mine. They come in beautiful colors. I chose light green, which is a soft pretty green. The color is somewhat lighter than the photos.I'm glad that I purchased these towels & definitely plan to buy more as needed.5 stars - highly recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'camelfox', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My wife needed a lighter weight towel as her strength has waned. These are light weight but very soft and absorbent and a true white. And as luck would have it, they are (were) on sale for over 50% off. After receiving one set of these, She was delighted and ordered another set to take advantage of the sale price. I like the wash clothes which are larger, ie longer diagonally allowing me grab the diagonal points and scrub my back. I hope the other colors are as bright as the white.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: FORMERLY HAMMAM, Not The Same Quality', 'author': 'Anthony', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE:Well this is one of those "I Spoke To Soon Scenario" because these towels have turned out after a few washing to be fluffed up very nicely and are really nice and absorbent and nice weight despite the name change and being made in Pakistan. They actually are a lot better than they were under the old name I love\'em. I would recommend these bath towels and will buy again. I had a loose thread on the side edge of one towel that I trimmed away and it was no problem with the sewing of the seam and was perfectly in-tacked the rib design is sturdy even though there only on one end of the towel. I will enjoy the bath towels very much, I hope this update helps!These bath towels are not HAMMAM, but are now HAWMAM.Not only has the name changed but the quality. They are made in Pakistan now NOT Turkey.The side seam on one of the four came frayed all along one side after the first wash and the rib design across the towels are different and not as nice as they were under the previous Hammam company name.I messaged the seller about the name on the add not matching on the picture of the label and the name of the seller and the heading of the listing but I never got a response, also messaged Amazon as well with no response as to why the listing said one name and the Label on the towel saying another name on the listing.So I took a chance ordering them anyway, my fault, I wish I hadn\'t, they are just not as good a quality as when they were under the original company name. I wouldn\'t recommend these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice but not Luxury', 'author': 'Robin Nicole', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. The towels are well made, bright white and will be a great addition to any bathroom. They are soft once washed. However, I was expecting a thicker, more velvety towel. I have Grand Patrician Five Star Hotel Brand bath towels that I was expecting this towel's quality to match up to. My towel is heavier, thicker and softer even after having washed it more times than I can count.The pictures and video depict the difference. The pictures and video were taken after I washed and dried the Hawman Linen bath towel. The difference in thickness was most notable when I was setting up the side by side pic of both towels folded in a loop. My towel propped up and stayed in position with no problem, the Hawman towel kept flopping. The Hawman bath towel is at decent price point for the quality and will definitely do the job. However, if you are looking for Lux, you may want to pass.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Pink color is off', 'author': 'Linnie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered these for the bright pink color which is scarce to find. The color is more of a muted pink. The washcloths ordered at the same time is even yet another shade of pink. Hand towels should arrive tomorrow. I am hoping they match closer to the towel color since they will be displayed on a towel rack. I plan to wash them all together to hopefully even out the tones should any of them fade. The material itself seems standard to most towels. Not a real high quality but will work for every day use to dry off. I will update once I have recieved the hand towels and have washed them all.Update: After washing first time I do have 3 different shades of pink. I had ordered towels, hand towels and wash clothes. The washcloths are the lightest pink almost muted. The hand towels are truest to color as in the pictures advertisement. And the towels are slightly muted. They are definetly not the bright pink as pictured. I am very disappointed and almost ashamed to put them on the towel rack together. They will work to dry off with though. I was really hoping for that bright cheerful pink.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars nice basic towels', 'author': 'ice29', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like how those towels are not too thick, I prefer my towels to dry quickly. Overall I am happy with the purchase and will be buying more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good towel so far.', 'author': 'RR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Update: adding that 5th star. The more I use these towels, the more I like them. The towels are really big, thick, and fluffy. However, some of them are defective! I have other towels from this brand that are great and the other towel in this shipment was just fine except the one already damaged. I would still purchase more because I really love the look and feel of these towels, but just know its a 50/50 chance you are going to get some that come already damaged for whatever reason! I had order the large towel sheets in a dark gray color from this brand and they never shedded or left fuzz all over my skin after showering, so hopefully these new ones dont either. I ordered the towel sheets because they are big without knowing how big the towels I received today were going to be. But let me tell you, even these regular bath towels are extremely big and wrap around your whole body and Im a big bodied person. If you can handle taking a chance on receiving some defective towels then I highly recommend these towels because they are worth the money if you get the ones not damaged.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the cost', 'author': 'JH', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love these towels. Besides that they all had or got snags easily. I’m not spending that money for just towels like that. Which brings me to the reason that I’m spending so much time on this review. When I bought the first set I loved them. No snags and not much lint ever since and they are unbelievably soft and fluffy. After a few washes they are holding up really well! No snags (or whatever they are called I’m sure you can figure it out.) they dry quickly. So I hope my experiences help with your decision. title: Tens Towels 8 Piece Towels Set, 2 Extra Large Bath Towels, 2 Hand Towels, 4 Washcloths, 100% Cotton, Lighter Weight, Quicker to Dry, Super Absorbent, Perfect Bathroom Towels Set (Dark Grey)
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and soft. Great size. Pretty dark color that hasn't faded so far.", 'author': 'Gggirlgeek', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great so far. I washed and double-rinsed them once, in cold water, normal setting. We\'ve used and washed/dried them twice since as well (we use unscented Persil detergent.) I didn\'t see excessive lint or shedding at all -- just normal, like old towels. They haven\'t torn or frayed. I dry my face on them and get no residue.They are nice and soft, and very absorbent. I do use a cup of vinegar in a Downy ball that releases during the double-rinse cycle of my HE top-loading machine. (I find that double-rinsing helps keep my towels soft, and helps prevent itchy skin too.) I also use 1 sheet of unscented softener in my LOW-temperature dryer. They seem to dry a bit faster than my heavier cotton towels, so 1 low cycle is all that\'s required for us -- about an hour. (They are a bit lighter in weight than classic cotton towels. But there is no suspicious lack of absorption from synthetic polyester. They are normal thickness, not thin.) I also have not seen any color-bleeding onto our clothes, but I have not washed them with whites. No uneven fading either so far.These are nice and huge. My 6\'6" husband loves them. I will be ordering 4 more regular towels for the normal sized beings in the house. These are too long to wrap my hair with.The color is a nice, dark indigo-navy -- dark purplish blue -- Seahawks blue. I love it. They pair well with white, or silver-grey, or tan, or even chartreuse -- Seahawks green.My husband does not like that he has to dry them on low, and wash them in cold water without bleach. He tends to get really rough when washing towels, motivated by germaphobia. The solution to that is to use 1/4 cup of Pinesol or Lysol in the wash instead of bleach (1/2 cup for old-school non-HE top loaders.) The strong scent will disappear when they dry. His bleach addiction disintegrated our white cotton towels, along with high-temperature drying. That is why I got the dark color -- he doesn\'t get obsessed with getting them sparkling white anymore. Our dryer gets extremely hot so I would say these towels can stand up to Medium temperature in most household dryers, if you want extra germ-killing-power. Ours kills germs even on low for an hour (above 140F.) In commercial laundromats, definitely use the LOW temperature to keep them from wearing out quickly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft,Absorbent,thick and big!', 'author': 'Judy Kelsh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The towels are very large and thick sooo comfortable. Love them after a shower, bath or hot tub time!! Quality towel! Will definetly buy more!! ❤️', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good towels', 'author': 'Jason', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The quality is good overall, especially for the price. They are definitely better than others I have seen at the same price point. The bath towels are huge. They were nice and soft after washing. They are kind of thin and not the most absorbent I have ever had but I would buy them again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very soft and absorbent', 'author': 'D. Peña', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice set with oversized bath towels, hand towels and washcloths. They are very soft and absorbent and lightweight as well, so they dry quickly when hung up. A nice set for the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extra soft', 'author': 'Marian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I loved these. I was looking for bigger size bath towels that were extra soft. These feel really good. They are extra absorbent and seem to dry quickly after use. I also love the dark blue color. It feels like high quality and it’s well sewn.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great Size and for Everyday', 'author': 'Dly29', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These are a great color and much larger than I thought they would be. The only real complaint is they are a bit thinner and not super plush or soft. The price is about right for the quality you get.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect balance', 'author': 'Lorraine B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I liked that these are ample sized, absorbent, and soft. Now- on the absorbency part- I tried to reason that, since these are "beach towels" perhaps they didn\'t want them super absorbent due to the sand and water etc. So if that\'s what they were going for...that\'s a job well done. If I could manage to get past the material, the craftmanship was just...why would you sell this? It\'s like an unfinished pillow case. The stitching is like raw serger stitch. title: Luxury Silk Hemming Towel Set - Light Thin Quick Drying - 2 Bath Towels 2 Hand Towels 2 Washcloths - Ultra Soft Microfiber, for Bath Fitness, Sports, Yoga, Travel (Dark Grey 6 Pieces)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These feel amazing! Ordering more!', 'author': 'John Alarcon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This material feels amazing!I got the 6-piece set – 2 towels, 2 hand towels, and 2 washcloths, just to give the microfiber a try and I\'m totally thrilled with these! There\'s a tag stitched on which says they\'re "100% coral velvet" – I\'ve never heard of that before but I definitely want more of it in my life!The cloth is very lightweight, reasonably thick, extra soft, kind of stretchy, super absorbent, and dries quickly. What more could you ask for?! I bought this set for the house but it immediately found its way into my camp gear where lightweight, quick-dry towels are a must. One of the attached photos shows the full set in a vacuum-seal bag – it barely takes up any space at all so this set would even work for backpacking.The towels were sized exactly like I hoped and it only took a single towel to dry off after a shower, just like any common towel. For reference, I\'m a 6\' and 180# man. One thing to note is that there\'s not much left to the imagination if you just wrap one around your waist after a shower.The washcloths were the typical size but the hand towels were quite a bit longer than I had hoped. All the pieces have a nice hem stitched around the border and while I can\'t talk about durability this early in, I can say that it looks like a nice job.As I\'m sitting here writing this review, I have another 6-piece set already in my cart...which pretty much tells you all you need to know.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Softness and Durability for Your Workout Needs!', 'author': 'Donald B', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the TENSTARS Silk Hemming Hand Towels for my workout routine, and I must say, they have exceeded my expectations in every way! These towels are an absolute game-changer when it comes to comfort, absorbency, and overall quality.First and foremost, the softness of these towels is simply unmatched. The microfiber material used in their construction feels incredibly gentle against the skin, providing a luxurious experience every time I use them. It's like wrapping myself in a cloud of comfort after an intense workout session.One of the standout features of these towels is their exceptional absorbency. Despite their lightweight nature, they effortlessly soak up moisture, leaving my skin feeling dry and refreshed. Whether it's sweat from a tough gym session or water from a post-workout shower, these towels quickly and efficiently do their job, allowing me to proceed with my day without any discomfort.Durability is another area where these towels shine. Even after several washes, they have maintained their softness and remained in excellent condition. The hemming is impeccably done, ensuring the towels withstand regular use without fraying or unraveling. I truly appreciate the attention to detail and craftsmanship put into their design.The 16x28-inch size is perfect for my needs, providing ample coverage and convenience. Additionally, the light grey color is elegant and versatile, complementing any bathroom decor or workout environment.Lastly, the fact that this set comes with six towels is a fantastic value for the price. It allows me to have multiple towels readily available for my workouts, ensuring I always have a fresh and clean towel at hand. Plus, the limited-time deal made this purchase even more irresistible.In conclusion, the TENSTARS Silk Hemming Hand Towels have become an indispensable part of my workout routine. Their combination of softness, absorbency, and durability is truly exceptional. If you're looking for high-quality towels that provide an indulgent experience, look no further. I wholeheartedly recommend these towels to anyone in need of a reliable and luxurious companion for their fitness, gym, shower, hotel, or spa activities.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft as butter! Dries like a sponge!', 'author': 'Paula Van', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are great .. even ordered another set in diff color. The softness is indescribable and as far as drying your skin, granddaughter tested it out. It's alot prettier \U0001fa76. PS the large towel is very long, yet not heavy and bulky.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Soft and absorbent, but pretty small', 'author': 'Ryan Anzaldi', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Like most shoppers, I was attracted to these towels because of the price. I got tired of passing over bath towels in stores due to insane price tags, so I was elated when I found a pair of these for under $10. When the package arrived, I realized why they were so cheap: they\'re very tiny. Now, this is not to suggest they don\'t do the job: they provide lots of coverage, and, as stated, are insanely absorbent. I merely have to pat the wet areas of my skin with the towel, and any excess water is quickly absorbed. The towels dry quickly as well!Above all, they are incredibly soft and comfortable. What I've found what a great light weight option for the newest revolutionary products.I don't have to worry about my towels smelling molded after a couple of uses, which made me wash them kicker, all because of the time it took to dry those bulky towels.Let me get to the point.Thin good for drying quickly after use.Absorbent.Has a long usage life before washing.Cute many colors, inexpensive, can be recycled ♻️, not traditional but at this point who cares, the old way of looking at the decorative and functional use of the old towels brings in much appreciation for the type of towel. Whether your bathroom has a modern, classic, or minimalist design, these towels will effortlessly enhance the overall aesthetic.Lastly, I must mention the excellent customer service provided by Chakir Turkish Linens. They were responsive, professional, and ensured that my order arrived in perfect condition. Their commitment to customer satisfaction is evident, and it further reinforces my confidence in their brand.In conclusion, the Chakir Turkish Linens 8-Piece Towel Set is a luxurious addition to any bathroom. Its exceptional quality, softness, absorbency, durability, and excellent customer service make it a top choice for elevating the bathing experience. I highly recommend these Turkish towels to anyone in search of a premium product that combines comfort, functionality, and style. Choose Chakir Turkish Linens and indulge in the luxury of superior towel quality!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars BEST QUALITY TOWELS I HAVE EVER PURCHASED', 'author': 'Melissa Borrelli', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was a bit skeptical about ordering these towels because they were not outrageously expensive. They are made in Turkey which is probably why. Anything made in CHINA is always cheaper but certain to be junk and not long lasting.I foresee these being worth the price of the additional ones i will buy and completely get rid of all of the old ones i have been hanging onto all these years.I will be buying at least 2 of the bath sheets for the needs of the other humans that live in my house. title: Fade-Resistant Microfiber Super Soft Plush Highly-Absorbent Microfiber Quick-Dry Towel Sets, 4 Pieces, 1 Bath Towels 1 Hand Towel and 2 Washcloths-Royal Blue
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Counter-opinion to some of the negative reviews', 'author': 'Xiaodaut', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had these towels for about a year now. These are softer/fluffier than the JML towels, and the JML towels don't dry my body as well as these do.These towels are microfiber, and not the same as cotton towels. If you are expecting the same experience as cotton, it is not going to happen with microfiber. Here are some of the differences:- Microfiber towels (all of them) tend to 'roll' a bit (bunch up) in your hand when you are drying off. All of them do this and you have to adjust your drying technique or how you hold the towel. It is not a difficult skill to learn.- They don't dry your body as bone-dry as really excellent cotton towels, but if you use fabric softener on your cotton towels, these will dry about the same.- After use or washing, they dry in minutes. Like, less than 20 minutes in my dry climate.- You can't put them in the dryer except air dry, you can't wash them in hot water- You can't use bleach on them, so if you are going to blot up that red wine spill on your carpet, don't do it with these.- These have maintained their fluffiness pretty well, but I never wash in hot or hot dry them- They are waaaaaay easier to launder than regular towels. I actually just wash these with my regular clothes (t-shrits, wash/wear work shirts, etc.) and have had no catastrophic laundry incidents to date.- I've hung these on the line without air-drying in the dryer and they are not as fluffy unless you shake vigorously. The JML-style of microfiber towels might be better if you don't have a dryer.- I've also hand-laundered these (hand-wash with a wringer or spinner) and they are sooooo much easier to deal with than cotton towels. This is the original reason why I switched to microfiber.I came back today to purchase some more for guests because I think they are great!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing', 'author': 'Ally B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So soft and cute!! Buying my towels in person from now on.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These are CRAZY!! It is half way dry when I take it off and greatly reduces my blow dry time, saving heat damage on your hair. I do NOT have curly hair, and I have wondered how it will work with curly hair and if it will leave you a little frizzy... I can\'t speak to that but do see it as a potential \'thing\'.For the body. The first time I used it, I hated it. I am used to moving a towel over my skin to dry it. Well, these don\'t slide!! But they absorb the moisture FAST. You basically just need to blot yourself and you are dry and ready to put on lotion or clothes or whatever you do when you are dry after the shower. An unexpected bonus: Sometimes in the winter I dread getting out of the shower. It is so cold and the shower was so nice and warm, then you turn it off, "dry" yourself and get out...and freeze. These get you so dry that I haven\'t really noticed being cold after a winter shower, so that has been nice.So, if you haven\'t used a microfiber towel on yourself before, it may take a tiny bit of getting used to, but even my husband has been using these without complaint (so that must mean he likes it!). I try to wash them after morning showers and hang them back on the towel rack to dry so they are ready by the next day\'s shower. The way they feel is just unparalleled.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Noticeably Softer', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I read somewhere that a person’s preference of towels with a 600 GSM (this is a measure of density) or greater is simply a matter of personal taste. I would expect to find these (700 to 900 GSM) in an upscale hotel. I do like them for their feel!I washed them separately in warm water to see if the color changed (it didn’t) or if there was any lint detectable in the washer (none detected). I dried them in my dryer on low heat and there was only a small amount of lint in the dryer filter. Also, they were just as soft as pre-washing.These towels have no border design which is okay with me. It makes folding them easier. I chose ivory as the color and they are easy to match with just about anything. The other available colors look great in pictures too.I think these towels will hold up well with frequent washing or drying. I say “or drying,” because I don’t like to hang towels to dry and sometimes put them into the dryer to avoid wet towels hanging up to dry for a long time.These seem fairly priced and I may order another set to keep for my guests.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars not as soft as I was hoping, and more "grey" than charcoal, but excellent absorbtion', 'author': 'J TAYLOR', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The towels are great, they'll get a lot of use, and I'm getting a second set, however, I dropped a single star as the towels are not a silky soft as previous Turkish towels I've got, and they arrived a lighter grey than the picture suggested. title: Amazon Brand – Pinzon 6 Piece Blended Egyptian Cotton Bath Towel Set - Moss
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon brand, Pinzon', 'author': 'ceedreamer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am the type of person, that once I purchase something and it worked for myself and my husband, I never, or rarely deviated from that product. Shopping for new towels after many, many years, the only shade of a color I was searching for, came up in the Pinzon line, which is the Amazon brand. Thought about ordering the towels that looked a shade or two off, as they were the name brands we had always purchased, when one of the big mall stores had a sale. It is difficult for both of us to go shopping at stores and malls as my better half has health problems, and I have become totally disabled. So, just going out to shop, is in our past. I have kept the household and us, running smoothly by shopping at Anazon, thus far. But this nagging feeling I had about changing the richness of the color scheme we have set ourselves up for in a bathroom that was redone, in preparation for the last time in our lives, to redecorate had me worried. They LOOKED nice and fluffy, and MOST towels are very absorbent. But I have also seen towels in store advertisements that, once in the store, the product looks and feels, NOT as advertised. At times, it resembled nothing like the pictures and descriptions. So, after discussing it with my other half, we decided to "take a leap", for once and go with Pinzon, Amazon\'s brand. I admit I worried about authenticity of both color and quality many times, as I awaited the delivery. Oh my! When they came, was I surprized! Not only did they all match perfectly, the QUALITY was beyond my expectations! They are thick, beautiful towels that are fluffy, wash beautifully and are so soft! On top of that, the color scheme matched perfectly! My other half even remarked about these towels, and he rarely says anything about a product, unless he does not like it. So THAT in itself was a bonus. I have always opted for the "other" brand when choosing what to purchase on Amazon. After this experience, I will be ordering Pinzon towels for another bathroom, once we are done re-doing things like paint and flooring. They happen to have another shade of a color, that will match another bath perfectly. From now on, I won\'t be as rigid as to my choices of what we have liked and worked for us before. Amazon REALLY surprised me, in that not only did they come out with their own line of merchandise, but thus far it exceeded my expectations for quality! I have been "sold"!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I've never gotten good or bad feedback from the recipients but I was ...", 'author': 'CS', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought one set of these because I've bought them a few times as gifts. I've never gotten good or bad feedback from the recipients but I was looking for a new set for my home and liked the design and color choices. I was worried because I saw a lot of bad reviews about them falling apart in the wash.I selected the moss color. When I got them in the color was just too dark for what I was looking for and they felt scratchy so they sat unopened for the longest time. I ended up going to a local store and getting what I wanted in a thicker but cheaper towel. When I brought the new ones home from the store I put them in their first wash with a cup of white vinegar and nothing else and then dried them without any softener. I was in love and very happy with my towels until... I decided to just go ahead and wash the Pinzon set in white vinegar and no softener.I begrudgingly have to admit I was wrong and now my husband has claimed them for himself. The ones I bought locally are thick and soft but they more push the water around your skin than absorb. I don't mind because I like large and soft towels especially to wrap my hair in. The Pinzon towels came out great from that first wash and softened up well. The difference is that they are a brisk towel that dry your hair and body fast. Very no nonsense which appeals to my husband.I've held off reviewing because I wanted to have a ton of washes in to be able to securely review the quality. I originally purchased the towel on right around Christmas, it's now February 25th. There's not been one busted seam, no picks, no holes, no tears and no fading so far. I typically cram as many clothes into my washer as it can hold which to no end annoys my husband who is more of the type to fill it 3/4s of the way full. We have front loaders, not sure if that would make a difference. I will come back in a few months if anything changes but so far so good. Hope it keeps that way.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good mid weight towels but linty...', 'author': 'Wen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I purchased this line of towels in the Moss and Wedgwood colors. Researched "washing new towels" and ended up washing them in warm water with detergent and white vinegar then detergent and baking soda. This is supposed to set the color and accelerate removing the coating that is put on new towels (which interferes with absorbency). I did this 4 times (drying in dryer after each wash). This process did seem to get rid of the coating and lint faster. BUT, the difference in the amount of lint generated by the moss set and the Wedgwood set was tremendous! The moss set shed barely a handful of lint thru the process but the Wedgwood set shed at least 6-7 large handfuls of lint ! (I also bought a Pinzon 550 GSM set in coral and had the same lint nightmare!).What I like: The colors! Which match the pics pretty closely. The banding does not shrink. They are soft and absorbent (after the washings). Good quality mid weight towel.What I don\'t like: Lint!! Don\'t understand how in the world Amazon can say their towels won\'t shed much after the first wash. The coating put on the towels. One of the Wedgwood hand towels came apart at the side seam after first wash. The corner of one of the Moss bath towels was not sewn down completely.Overall: I like these mid weight towels, would purchase again and think they are priced right.I suggest Amazon should include instructions for the initial washing process of their towels (with the vinegar, wash/dry frequency, etc.). Customers would have a more favorable view of their towels if they had a more positive, quick, and less annoying experience with getting rid of the lint and increasing the towels\' absorbency.But what I REALLY wish is that some brilliant Research & Development person will think to market towels that are sold without a coating and already defuzzed!! I would buy them......And I would cuss less......', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I think Amazon spec'd these towels pretty well when you consider weight, feel, looks, performance, and price.", 'author': 'Barnacle Bill The Sailor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I looked and looked for towels to go with a master and guest bath I just renovated. There are tons of choices with advertised GSM weights from 300 to 900 and prices all over the place like the weights. The marketing touts Turkish cotton, Egyptian cotton, and others.I ended up ordering these Amazon Pinzon branded towels, 3 sets each in green and white. The 600 GSM weight seemed like a good balance of weight and price. And I liked the colors.I was a little concerned by reviews that said they were "too thin" or "cheap" but those are subjective things. If you\'re used to 900 GSM spa towels yeah, they may seem thin. But I decided to give them a try.The instructions said to give them an initial wash and they will fluff up. I found that to be true. They are packed pretty tight and looked compressed right out of the bag. But after a wash and dry, they fluffed up and feel really nice.As for being "thin" or "cheap", they seem very nice to me. Personally, I don\'t like super heavy towels. Like everything else this GSM weight thing can be taken to extremes. I think there\'s a balance point between a towel that\'s easy to handle and one that feels like you\'re grabbing a rug. Also I\'ve found that the really heavy weight towels don\'t necessarily dry me off any better or faster than a mid weight towel like these. And those big thick towels can be hard to hang over a towel bar.At the end of the day, I think Amazon spec\'d these towels pretty well when you consider weight, feel, looks, performance, and price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful towels!', 'author': 'Daisycat68', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Having seen there are mixed reviews, I took a chance and purchased only 1 set of 6. I thought, if they suck, I won't have a ton of them. I was shocked at how amazing they are.First, I got the MOSS. Maybe different colors have different quality? They towels are a rich, dark green and very soft, both before and after washing. They are thicker and heavier than any towel I have ever seen. They do take a while to dry, but only because they ate so dense.I did wash them once and have been using them. I can't speak to their longevity at this point, but other Pinzon products (like my comforters) have lasted forever. I hope the quality stays with these. I plan on ordering more sets over time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely soft but sturdy; Wrap up like a burrito', 'author': 'Emma', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m always hesitant ordering towels off-line because of false advertising. I was not disappointed with these though. They are very soft but sturdy. After I washed them and went to use, I was waiting for something to start unraveling or getting fuzzies all over me. Again, that wasn\'t the case. These surprised me greatly! As long as the seller stays the same, I will definitely be ordering more of these. Highly recommended if you want an absorbent towel with a soft sturdy texture. Also, the towels are a good size, considering I like towels big enough to feel like a blanket....these achieved just that. Keep in mind I\'m not that big (5\'10"; 125lbs.), but they are still wide enough to cover me entirely and long enough to wrap myself like a burrito. Hopefully, this helps you make your decision.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'MsWethany', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I don't know if I got lucky, but I ordered the moss color and liked them so much I ordered a second set. I can't tell them apart. They're all really good, the bath towel is slightly bigger than average and they seem thicker too. The only thing I am not a fan of is the decorative woven bands on the washcloths take up too much space. I'd like more terry softness on my washcloths. But the color is lovely and everything else is great and especially for the low price I'm extremely pleased.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Liked them so much I bought a second set', 'author': 'Happy Amazoner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I already have a set of these towels, so I bought a second set based on how much I like them. When I looked it up, I was surprised to see that my other ones were 3 years old, as they still look and feel like new. They are the wedge wood color, and they have not faded at all. I do put A&H washing soda ( not baking soda), in the wash every time, and it keeps towels from having odors, and maybe helps keep the colors bright too. When I washed the new moss colored towels, they did not fade, and they are nice and soft. Very happy with Pinzon towels.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality towels for not much $$$', 'author': 'aimlynn', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The good:They're thick and big towels. Nice colors. Cheap (but not cheap quality).The bad:As others have noted in reviews, they fuzz all over EVERYTHING at first. Empty the lint dryer several times the first time you dry them, and wash them alone. We're on 4 washes now and this has calmed down but the amount of lint that came out of them at first was unreal!They do seem less absorbent than my old towels. Not terrible, but noticeable.Lastly, I got the dark green color and use face creams/washes that contain chemicals (salicylic acid, Retinoids) and it seems that it might be bleaching small spots into the towels :(. Be careful if you use face washes that have fancy chemicals in them and buy a dark colored towel. Again, it's not horrible, but disappointing since I've only had them for a month and it's likely only to get worse over time. I'd buy a light color next time.Overall, I'd purchase again, just buy a lighter color so I don't have to worry about bleaching from face wash.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice towels!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I am pleasantly surprised that these towels are so nice because of the low price I paid. They are thick and soft. I washed them in cold water after reading other reviews, even though the instructions say wash in hot water. They still look great and there was very little lint on the dryer lint screen. Don’t hesitate to give these a chance. Color looks exactly as it appears on line.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]
